decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to generate a looped milling effect. By repeatedly casting and sacrificing artifacts, such as Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble, the player can generate a large amount of mana and then use it to recast their entire graveyard with Underworld Breach. This loop can be used to either mill the opponent out of cards or to find and play Thassa's Oracle for a game-winning effect. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Unholy Heat to interact with the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Hardened Scales deck is to maximize the power and toughness of creatures through multiple sources, such as Hardened Scales, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager. The deck also utilizes modular abilities, as seen with Hangarback Walker and Walking Ballista, to generate additional value and provide a threat even after they are destroyed. Inkmoth Nexus provides an alternate win condition through infect damage. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga and The Ozolith allows for further synergy and value generation. The deck aims to be aggressive and overwhelming, quickly building up a threatening board presence.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The key concept revolves around utilizing low-cost burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Skewer the Critics to deal direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear are included to put pressure on the opponent and maintain a fast pace. The deck also incorporates cards like Searing Blaze and Boros Charm to control the board state and protect its creatures. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed, direct damage, and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use control elements and powerful artifacts to control the game and gain advantage over the opponent. The key card in the deck is "The One Ring," which serves as a win condition and helps in maintaining card advantage. The deck also includes several removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict to deal with opponent's threats. Additionally, it includes powerful cards such as Karn, the Great Creator and Cling to Dust for further control and versatility. The mana base includes lands like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to generate additional resources.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize creatures with toolbox abilities combined with a combo aspect. The deck aims to create a synergistic engine by using cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Chord of Calling to search for and sacrifice creatures for value. It also includes cards like Blood Artist and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to gain life and drain the opponent. The deck relies on efficient mana production through cards like Wall of Roots and Ignoble Hierarch, and also utilizes proactive creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Strangleroot Geist to apply pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on using Chord of Calling to tutor specific creatures from the deck, creating a toolbox of creatures that can be used for various purposes. It utilizes creatures such as Wall of Roots, Young Wolf, Strangleroot Geist, and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate value and control the board. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provides card draw and removal options. The deck also includes some utility lands such as Pendelhaven and Dryad Arbor. The overall strategy is to assemble the right combination of creatures to create powerful synergies and overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive playstyle using a combination of low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can quickly deal damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Thoughtseize. It also includes removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt to eliminate threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes graveyard synergy with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Fury to further disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure on the battlefield.

This deck is a Control archetype that focuses on using a mix of different colored mana sources to cast powerful spells and control the game. It utilizes a combination of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the board. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Valki, God of Lies to put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, it features a variety of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to handle threats. Overall, the key concept is utilizing a diverse range of cards to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize control elements and cards that generate value over time to control the game and outlast the opponent. It is a 4-color control deck that focuses on using Teferi, Time Raveler to control the opponent's spells, while also utilizing cards like Wrenn and Six and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate value and card advantage. It also includes removal cards like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to handle threats. The deck aims to stabilize the board and then grind out the game with powerful threats and control elements.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of control elements and powerful spells to gain control of the game and overpower the opponent. The deck focuses on using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six to control the opponent's actions while also ramping mana with cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells, such as Prismatic Ending, Solitude, and Fury, to deal with threats. Additionally, Leyline Binding and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines provide added control and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan combo to generate a lot of mana and search for powerful lands. The deck includes bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Golgari Rot Farm to generate extra mana, as well as lands like Tolaria West and Expedition Map to search for key pieces. The deck also includes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to ramp up the mana production even more. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble a combination of lands and creatures to overpower the opponent.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing creature toolbox cards such as Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for and assemble specific creatures needed for combos. The deck also includes a mix of powerful utility lands, like Urza's Saga and Yavimaya, Cradle of Growth, to further support the creature toolbox strategy. Additionally, key combo pieces like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven are included to create an infinite loop of sacrificing and returning creatures. The deck also features cards that generate additional value, such as Gilded Goose and Lonis, Cryptozoologist.

The key concept of this Combo - Hammer Time deck is to quickly assemble a powerful, evasive creature equipped with the Colossus Hammer, allowing it to deal massive damage and potentially win the game in a single attack. The deck aims to use cards like Puresteel Paladin, Stoneforge Mystic, and Sigarda's Aid to efficiently search for and equip the hammer, while also having backup plans such as Gingerbrute, Shadowspear, and Surge of Salvation to maintain a strong offense. Additionally, the deck incorporates efficient mana generation through cards like Springleaf Drum and Paradise Mantle to accelerate its game plan.
